Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
The last server reset was at Thu Aug 24 06:11:20 2017 UTC
We're on Twitter! @StarConquest for server status notifications and out-of-game
contact!

    * Welcome to Star Conquest! *
[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a dusky pink rattan cabinet, a small red ball containing a realistic
Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy pale purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a large oval
dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a white four poster rattan bed with a
heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle
cashmere blanket, a set of lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow,
a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow
on it, a small purple trash bin, a small oval turquoise rattan table with a
glass top, a pocket-sized purple holovid, a pair of gray canvas sneakers, and
Prissy the big violet long-haired felo here.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident is dozing on a white four poster rattan bed.
You can go out.
(You are lying on a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard
and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a set of
lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow, a hand-made purple and
amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it.)

feel inspired to earn more points afterward!

pet prissy

hand, looking up at you adoringly.

Corlew chuckles.

[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "Delicious."

Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.

multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!

    * Welcome to Star Conquest! *
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is at Space Market.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a black plastic tray of spider chow, a compact white refrigerator, an
insulated black cooler, a robotic chef named Nellie, and Purr the humanoid
service robot here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is at Space Market.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a black plastic tray of spider chow, a compact white refrigerator, an
insulated black cooler, a robotic chef named Nellie, and Purr the humanoid
service robot here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident just entered the ship.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident begins the launch sequence.
kiss lily
You kiss Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident.
wrap lily
You wrap your arms around Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident, pulling her close.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident smiles at you.
-lily Hi beautiful!
You say to Lily, "Hi beautiful!"
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident wraps her arms around you, pulling you close.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident presses a button and brings up the starship's
navigation controls.
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: New Earth.
The ship's computer automatically requests landing clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Hello, William Dove. We read your AEU
transponder. You are cleared to land at the city of New Phoenix."
Flight Control: Flight control in New Earth, AEU gunship incoming.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident pulls a large lever towards her.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
The computer sounds a notification indicating that the ship has been fully
charged.
smile lily
You smile at Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident.
cuddle lily
You cuddle up to Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident.
peer out
You peer out...
[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The four-person mule "Lion's Den" and the five-person A.S.S. tactical platform
"William Dove" are landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident squeezes you affectionately.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident cuddles up to you.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident says, "Be right back. Going to go check the GSL's
office and Range office."
squeeze lily
You squeeze Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident affectionately.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident glides out.
out

You scramble to your feet.
[Starship "William Dove"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, an
early warning space defense device, a glossy sky blue ceramic felo chow bowl,
KitCat the humanoid service robot, an insulated red sleeping bag, and a personal
hoverpallet here.
You can go out and enter into the ship.
go office
Go where?
out
You exit the ship.
[New Earth; Piper Wincott Memorial Garage]
You can go up.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit

[General Communication] Rogue Pilot Eli Grey snickers.
A firmly rooted animal with dozens of smooth yellow tendrils slowly waves its
many tendrils.

what beef fed beef stock would be."
[General Communication] Johann Schraft transmits, "So we have cownivors and
cornivors."

You gently caress Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident's back.
[General Communication] Ted Warburton transmits, "But people think badly of
cannibalism, yet it's OK for beef fed corn stock but not beef fed beef stock if
that's true."
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "As would a corn-fed cornstalk.
Both cannibals."
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "'cause it ain't eatin its own
kind."
[General Communication] Johann Schraft transmits, "Seriously though, I would
imagine if you killed a cow and buried it in a corn field, it would make great
fertilizer."
[General Communication] Evenia Callseah chortles. "You guys have clearly had a
while to consider this carefully."
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "Not long."
[General Communication] Ted Warburton transmits, "But why should eating beef be
wrong for beef but not corn?"
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "Why should eating humans be
wrong for humans, but felo takin a chomp outta us is all fine."
[General Communication] Ted Warburton transmits, "I never said that was fine."
kiss lily on neck
You kiss Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident softly on the neck.
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "I'm makin an analogy..."
[General Communication] Ted Warburton transmits, "It's just interesting, how we
decide what's right or wrong."
[General Communication] Evenia Callseah transmits, "And we also laugh half the
time when we walk aboard a ship and they attack us by jumping at our heads."
Lily gently rubs your back.
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "We do. But we ain't happy when
they attack each other."
[General Communication] Ted Warburton transmits, "Only because we know we'll be
healed in a few minutes."
[General Communication] Evenia Callseah transmits, "Nah, that's true too."
[General Communication] Rogue Pilot Eli Grey transmits, "They only bite us
because they like the way we taste, so it's kinda our fault."
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "But if they bite each other
'cause they like the way they taste, is that right or wrong?"
[General Communication] Rogue Pilot Eli Grey transmits, "If they bite each
other, it could just mean they're getting ready for some light boning."
[General Communication] Ted Warburton transmits, "As long as them biting each
other is a sign that they will be good bari fighters."
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "Umm."
[General Communication] Evenia Callseah transmits, "I suppose that depends on
perspective. To us it's wrong because we don't like seein' 'em hurt each other.
But for all we know. It's like. Part of the felo hierarchy."
A firmly rooted animal with dozens of rough green tendrils slowly waves its many
tendrils.
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "Yep."
[General Communication] Ted Warburton transmits, "Now, there's a thought."
[General Communication] Rogue Pilot Eli Grey transmits, "Yeah, she put a better
way. I just meant that animals bite each other all the time for different
reasons."
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "Still, I don't like to see 'em
hurt each other but don't mind if they hurt me."
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "I don't mind eatin beef, but
somehow cattle eatin each other seems wrong."
Prissy the big violet long-haired felo wanders in from the airlock.
[General Communication] Ted Warburton transmits, "It's interesting how that kind
of feeling comes about though."
[General Communication] Rogue Pilot Eli Grey transmits, "Yeah, it does just have
a certain inherent wrogness to it."
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "And corn eatin beef...is just
weird 'cause in general, with a few exceptions, plants ain't sposed to do nothin
but sit there and absorb sunlight and nutrients."
[General Communication] Rogue Pilot Eli Grey transmits, "Er,  wrongness."

felo protecting the herd."

Johann."

Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident suddenly awakens.
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a black plastic tray of spider chow, a compact white refrigerator, an
insulated black cooler, a robotic chef named Nellie, and Purr the humanoid
service robot here.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured
couch.

2
Once a waystation between Old Earth and its newly settled colony, the Colonial
Gate station is now largely irrelevant, but still stands guard here as a sort of
watchtower.
The Centauri Colony remains Old Earth's only remaining major extrasolar
possession. The planet does not appear to be particularly teeming with life,
with the color of the land fading from brownish grasses to grey bedrock.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Centauri in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."

Welcome to Centauri Colony Orbit!"

[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, a dark green leather
captain's chair, and a small red insulated cooler here.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident is sitting on a dark green leather captain's
chair.
You can go east, southeast, and out.
(You are sitting on a dark green leather captain's chair.)
A Tardick lizard named Asteria flicks its tongue out from its perch on Lily
Kaise, Phoenix Dissident's shoulder.

pizza.

The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of

"Torment".

You see a large round light purple and dark purple cloth rug, an antique oak

 You are wearing a long-sleeved dark blue tee with a large white lightning bolt
appliqued on the front, a pair of slim navy blue linen trousers, and a pair of
washed light khaki canvas sneakers. Underneath this, you are wearing a pair of
white cotton briefs and a pair of white socks. You are also wearing a keychain,
a backpack, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a black leather phone holster, a
solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, and a gold wrist-mounted chronometer.
You are concealing a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator, a flight
control scanner, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, a scorched
metal thigh holster, a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a camera bag, a black
engineering tool case, a black flightbag with a red shooting star on the side,
and a leather briefcase. Your head, face, both eyes, neck, both wrists, and both
hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying nothing.

ftl chetumal
What was once a feature of interstellar geography is now the name of an
alliance, and the heart of Fringe space can be found past this gateway. The tiny
station of Nuevo Laredo stands guard here.
The planet of Chetumal floats before you here, the richest planet among the
Fringe Worlds, although that isn't saying a lot.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Chetumal in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."
move
Via general sector communication, Chetumal transmits, "Greetings, Deadly Strike!
Welcome to Chetumal Orbit!"

ftl new
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
Via general sector communication, AEU Battery-Powered Message Beacon transmits,
"Registered merchants, trading at Union ports funds plans that will endanger
human lives. Profit for Best is power to the Outsiders"
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Deadly
Strike! Welcome to home space!"

2
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:

This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to League Autonavigating Solar Weather Station in thirty seconds unless
aborted or another navigation order is entered."
Via general sector communication, League Autonavigating Solar Weather Station
transmits, "Current riftflow conditions are 2080 light-minutes per second from
Galactic Southwest and Slightly Down."
Via general sector communication, Beacon E-02 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'Deadly Strike.' Welcome to The Belt of Orion."

The sensors tell you that this area is full of valuable salvage, but all you can
see of it yourself is dark smudges that block the light of the stars.

The planet known as Teslaworld rotates below you, the atmosphere looking as
impenetrable as that of a gas giant. The thick clouds roil with continual
storms, and lightning flashes all across the sky many times a second.

[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, and a dark green
leather captain's chair here.
You can go east, southeast, and out.

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.

[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at The Torus; Dock Alpha.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, and a dark green
leather captain's chair here.
You can go east, southeast, and out.
peer out
You peer out...
[The Torus; Dock Alpha]
The pale gray walls, floor, and ceiling of this massive EAOS docking bay glow
with a pale white light. Though the bay remains open to space, it somehow also
retains its atmosphere. Outside, you can see the bright glint of a solitary
blue-white star. Signs indicate that the repair and rearm facility, the starship
supply store, and the main concourse are to the north.
The two-person flare "Deadly Strike" is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine here.
You can go north and down.
Your ship 'Deadly Strike' has been automatically moved into a garage.

[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded

entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the

l
[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, and a dark green
leather captain's chair here.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident is sitting on Shule Elemmire's lap.
You can go east, southeast, and out.
(You are sitting on a dark green leather captain's chair.)

rundown, and studies it for a moment.

Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident
She appears to be 28 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
mid-back length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick
fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a long-sleeved dark pink tee appliqued with small neon pink
dragonflies, a pair of skinny white low rise jeans, and a pair of white leather
clogs with a row of glittery fireflies across the toes. She is also wearing an
orange and white blessed prayer bracelet around her wrist, a slender bracelet of
tiny tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted
chronometer, a solid silver ring engraved with dragonflies, a delicate ring of
silver wire and small purple amethyst crystals, a metallic gold touch einrophone
in a metallic purple reinforced plastic phone holster, an elegant white gold
ring inset with a perfect solitaire diamond, a light purple flightbag with a
pastel kitten on the side, a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled
'Asteria', and a Tardick lizard named Asteria perched on her shoulder. Her head,
face, both eyes, neck, both wrists, both hands, and waist are left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.

l
[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, a dark green leather

This office is small but elegant, the recessed lighting shining softly over pale
green carpet, silvery white walls, and a modestly sized modern steel desk with
an ergonomically designed mesh and leather chair behind it. Arranged in front of

door is open.

l chair
a dark green leather captain's chair
This state of the art starship captain's chair is upholstered in dark green
leather and has a polished steel frame. The high back, seat, and armrests are
firmly but deeply padded to mitigate the vibrations, shaking, and sudden changes
of velocity of both normal starship operations and combat. The chair swivels
smoothly from side to side to provide an extended reach of control room
instrument panels.
On top of it you see a long-sleeved dark pink tee appliqued with small neon pink
dragonflies and a dark pink lace bullet bra.

l
[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, a dark green leather
captain's chair, and a small red insulated cooler here.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident is sitting on a dark green leather captain's
chair.
You can go east, southeast, and out.

sit chair
You're already sitting.
l chair
a dark green leather captain's chair
This state of the art starship captain's chair is upholstered in dark green
leather and has a polished steel frame. The high back, seat, and armrests are
firmly but deeply padded to mitigate the vibrations, shaking, and sudden changes
of velocity of both normal starship operations and combat. The chair swivels
smoothly from side to side to provide an extended reach of control room
instrument panels.
On top of it you see a long-sleeved dark pink tee appliqued with small neon pink
dragonflies and a dark pink lace bullet bra.

[New Earth; Pilot Corps Liaison Office]
This is a calm, relaxing room, clearly designed to comfort cadet pilots
terrified of being on their own out in space for the first time. There is a
quiet murmur of conversation, most of it emanating from the office staff as they
coordinate activities between the pilot league and the government on the ground.
One corner of the room is occupied by several comfortable chairs and decorative
plants, and a man constantly wearing a reassuring smile sits at a desk there. A
nameplate on his desk reads "CADET ORIENTATION." If a brand new cadet were
confused, or just not sure where to begin, they would TALK to him.

[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]
This roomy, circular lounge sits on the very lip of the landing pad outside,
with half of it suspended over the water below. Large transparisteel windows
overlook the ocean at one end and afford a great view of the landing pad at the
other, the material tinting itself automatically when needed. The walls, tables,
and floor are gleaming white lucite, kept immaculately clean by tiny drones that
zip around with automated efficiency. A row of couches face toward the windows,
leaving a relatively open section in the middle of the room. The news broadcast
flickers across the surface of each sleek white table to keep the pilots
informed of the latest goings-on. A stairway towards the back of the room has
its door open and bears a sign reading 'Garage'.

[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, a dark green leather
captain's chair, and a small red insulated cooler here.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident is dozing on a dark green leather captain's chair.
You can go east, southeast, and out.

l
[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, a dark green leather
captain's chair, and a small red insulated cooler here.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident is dozing on a dark green leather captain's chair.
You can go east, southeast, and out.
(You are sitting on a dark green leather captain's chair.)

read book
An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 14
Destroyers:
Three-Person Light Escort 15,000,000.00 (New Earth Blazing Trails)
AS-0A AEU LIGHT ESCORT VESSEL
Class: Destroyer
Requirements: 50 industry points        15 combat points
Model number: AS-0A                     Designation: Light Escort
Turret hardpoints: 10                   Launcher hardpoints: 1
Standard storage capacity: 20000        Standard battery hours: 10
Docking bay size required: 40
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 105%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
Max Cruising Speed: 102%
The light Escort is the first destroyer that an AEU pilot will ever have access
to. It's a reasonably well armed vessel, with no major bonuses. However, it can
still pack quite a punch, especially with more advanced upgrades and its single
launcher.
Three-Person Heavy Defense Vessel 7,500,000.00 (Endymion)
AD-1N AEU HEAVY DEFENSE VESSEL
Class: Destroyer
Requirements: 100 industry points       250 combat points
Model number: AD-1N                     Designation: Heavy Defense Vessel
Turret hardpoints: 12                   Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 20000        Standard battery hours: 4
Docking bay size required: 40
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 105%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
Max Cruising Speed: 102%
The defense vessel is a very well armed vessel, holding 12 turrets. It does have
a major disadvantage though, which likely also explains the cheaper cost. That
disadvantage is that it has no FTL drive. However, it can still be a very useful
ship, but just know if you want to take it anywhere you'll need to dock it
inside a bigger ship, or tug it around using a tugboat.
Three-Person Clipper 200,000,000.00 (New Earth Allied Technologies)
AS-4F AEU CLIPPER-CLASS ESCORT VESSEL
Class: Destroyer
Requirements: 750 industry points       750 combat points
Model number: AS-4F                     Designation: Clipper
Turret hardpoints: 12                   Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 20000        Standard battery hours: 14
Docking bay size required: 40
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 105%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
Max Cruising Speed: 102%
The Clipper is the most advanced destroyer that the AEU has. It's as armed as
the defense vessel with 12 turrets, but has the further advantage of a vastly
increased engine speed when it's going at maximum burn, and also has an extra
hull failsafe over the other two destroyers.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Deadly Strike, you are given launch
clearance under the AEU-League non-aggression pact."
ftl torus
2
Which sector did you mean?
[1] Torus Corridor (EAOS)
[2] The Torus (EAOS)
Enter your selection:
The perfect ring of The Torus spins serenely nearby.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to The Torus (Dock Alpha) in thirty seconds unless aborted or another
navigation order is entered."
Via general sector communication, The Torus transmits, "Greetings, Deadly
Strike! Welcome to The Torus!"

[Starship "Kalina"; Control Room]
You see a tiger stripe leather sofa, a soft rectangular white rug with a design
of black and cinnamon brown cats, and a black leather captain's chair here.
You can go south and out.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Kalina, you are given undock clearance
under the AEU-EAOS non-aggression pact."
Your ship 'Deadly Strike' has been automatically moved into a garage.
ftl new
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
Via general sector communication, AEU Battery-Powered Message Beacon transmits,
"Registered merchants, trading at Union ports funds plans that will endanger
human lives. Profit for Best is power to the Outsiders"
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Kalina!
Welcome to home space!"

power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.

launch

ftl endymion
You stumble, then fall heavily to the floor.
(3 seconds roundtime.)
A single star shines brightly in the dark here, the light strangely comforting.
The ship's sensors indicate that the star's spectrum is nearly identical to
Sol's.
Via general sector communication, AEU Battery-Powered Message Beacon transmits,
"Registered merchants, trading at Union ports funds plans that will endanger
human lives. Profit for Best is Power to the Outsiders.""
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Endymion in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."

wait.

--
AutoStar (general-purpose starship autopilot) Version 9.1
--
Destinations in this sector:
   Planets:
[1] Endymion

A handful of lonely beacons watch over this area of space, their lights glowing
palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.
You stumble, then fall heavily to the floor.
(3 seconds roundtime.)
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to AFW Command (Dock One) in thirty seconds unless aborted or another
navigation order is entered."

Sol's.

ftl drydock
A lone outpost glitters in an otherwise nondescript cloud of debris.
The League's legendary shipyards hang motionless in the dark here. Once, the
stations would be all but glowing with waste heat as the Intersector
Shipbuilding Company rolled out ship after ship. Now the stations are still and
darkened, and the ISC is no more.
A large frame hangs in space here, sufficiently large to at least contain a
battlecruiser-class starship.

A single star shines brightly in the dark here, the light strangely comforting.
The ship's sensors indicate that the star's spectrum is nearly identical to
Sol's.

"Registered merchants, trading at Union ports funds plans that will endanger
human lives. Profit for Best is Power to the Outsiders.""

proceed to Endymion in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."

l deadly
the two-person flare "Deadly Strike"
You see a corvette here.
"Deadly Strike" is written along its hull in flaming metallic yellow letters.
The designation "AW-2" is stamped in tiny letters near its landing struts.
This starship advertises its function with its form. It does not look
particularly flightworthy, with protruding turrets, communications equipment,
and a box-like protrusion in the rear where the reactionless drive and wormhole
drive reside. But, of course, it is not intended to fly through an atmosphere. A
small protrusion on the nose of the vessel is its main sensor relay. Only the
bottom appears smooth, and even that is marred by the extension of its landing
struts when not in flight.
The hull is gleaming and painted a deep green color with silver trim. Its laser
turrets are sleek and dangerous-looking and outlined in silver. Its landing
struts are flawless and strong and painted gunmetal grey.
It has an AEU logo forward on the port side and a smooth dome and a geodesic
radome on the forward end.
enter deadly
[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Airlock]
You can go out and enter into the ship.
enter
[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Control Room]
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, a dark green leather
captain's chair, and a small red insulated cooler here.
You can go east, southeast, and out.

HULL PLATING:                                     EAOS Plasma Resistant Plating
(225 damage absorption points) (modified to 100% by hull size and rated at 100%
of nominal) (Moderate resistance to minicannons)
REACTIONLESS DRIVE:                               EAOS Dual Reactionless Mk III
(Instantaneous velocity: 6000km/s, Maximum velocity: 27350 km/s, Acceleration
Rating: 25.0, Complete Deceleration in 5 seconds) (Running at 100% rated
efficiency and 0% rated maximum velocity)
MAIN SENSORS:                                     EAOS Superstring Perturbation
Sensor (Hull Lockon Rate: 25% Wormhole Drive Lockon Rate: 50% Cloak Resolution
Distance: 1 unit)
WEAPONS (Turrets):                                EAOS Crystalline Optics Laser
Mk II is operating at 16 damage per turret (110% of rated) and is operating at
100% of rated efficiency (Hull Accuracy Added: 5% Time To Fire: 4s)
STORAGE:                                          Merchant-Grade Storage
Compression (170% of standard)
MAIN BATTERY:                                     Revo Applied Technology Sink
(Overall Efficiency: 100% Combat Grid Usage: 100% Wormhole Drive Usage: 100% Max
Engine Speed: 6000km/s) (Maximum Charge: 100% of standard) (Drain Rate: n/a)
COMBAT ENERGY GRID:                               Telex Defense "Jackrabbit"
Combat Accelerator (Capacity: 1100 Time To Recharge: 200 seconds)  (modified to
100% by hull size)
TARGET TRACKING ARRAY:                            Luna Improved TT Array
(Maximum Targets: 1 Range: 2 units Near Target Retention: 100% Far Target
Retention: 50%)
LIFE SUPPORT:                                     Inactive
SENSOR DATA:                                      Includes Outsider Scan
Signatures

1)

manipulator (Response Time: 3.0s)

various changes to your liking.

l
[Starship "Albatross"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. The status lights overhead are
currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is in a garage.
You see an improved temporary wormhole drive here.
You can go north and down.

commands omnilock
Commands for a small omnilock:
--
Unique   attach omnilock to <something>
--
Common   get omnilock                            drop/throw omnilock
         give/hand omnilock to <something>
--
get mosaic
You pick up a mosaic star box.
attach omnilock to mosaic
You attach a small omnilock to a mosaic star box.
commands mosaic
Commands for a mosaic star box:
--
Unique   put <something> into mosaic             remove/take/get <something>
from mosaic
         open mosaic                             close mosaic
         open mosaic                             close mosaic
         empty mosaic                            view mosaic
         find <something> into mosaic            empty/emptyto mosaic into
<something>
--
Common   get mosaic                              drop/throw mosaic
         give/hand mosaic to <something>
--
l mosaic
a mosaic star box
This square box measures about twenty centimeters in all dimensions. It is made
of silver metal covered with a mosaic depicting a large stylized white star on
the top with a pale blue center and a deep midnight blue background spotted with
smaller red, blue, orange, and yellow stars. The white star's tendrils stream
outward in smooth arcs down the sides of the box, curving around additional
smaller stars. The mosaic's tiny pieces of broken plastic and the thin lines of
silver-colored cement holding them in place are covered with a thin high-gloss
glaze that is smooth to the touch.
It is closed.
open mosaic
You open a mosaic star box.
close mosaic
You close a mosaic star box.
You turn a small key in the lock of a mosaic star box and then pocket the key.
ope mosaic
I don't understand that.

You open a mosaic star box.

l photo
a photo of Lily Kaise
Lily Kaise is in the photo. She is standing.
She appears to be at Starship "William Dove"; Control Room.
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
abdomen is attractive and punctuated by a cute navel. Her face is oval and
pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are lovely and blush
pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth. Beneath a set of
arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her waist-length,
straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick fall of loose curls
down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled crimson dragon pierces her belly button, a small enameled
cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe, and a small enameled cerulean
blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a tight colorful cropped top, a colorful and very short skirt,
and a pair of adorable knee socks. She is also wearing an orange and white
blessed prayer bracelet around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling
silver bells around her wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid
silver ring engraved with dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire and small
purple amethyst crystals, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a metallic purple
reinforced plastic phone holster, a light purple flightbag with a pastel kitten
on the side, a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled 'Asteria', and a
reactionless spacesuit jet. Her head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows,
abdomen, both forearms, both wrists, both hands, both thighs, and both knees are
left uncovered.

l
[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, a dark green leather
captain's chair, and a small red insulated cooler here.
You can go east, southeast, and out.

visual
Get a visual of which ship?
[1] Lordy, The Phoenix Flies
Enter your selection:
1
You see a scout here.
"Lordy, The Phoenix Flies" is written along its hull in blocky silver letters.
The designation "AY-104" is stamped in tiny letters near its landing struts.
This starship advertises its function with its form. It does not look
particularly flightworthy, with protruding turrets, communications equipment,
and a box-like protrusion in the rear where the reactionless drive and wormhole
drive reside. But, of course, it is not intended to fly through an atmosphere. A
small protrusion on the nose of the vessel is its main sensor relay. Only the
bottom appears smooth, and even that is marred by the extension of its landing
struts when not in flight.
The hull is somewhat dull and painted a deep green color with silver trim. Its
laser turrets are blackened and outlined in silver. Its landing struts are clean
and painted gunmetal grey.
It has a smooth dome and a geodesic radome on the forward end.

[New Earth Ship Sales; Salvage Recovery Tools]
As customers and curious tourists enter this store, they inevitably instantly
glance up to observe the massive life-sized salvage recovery grapple suspended
along the ceiling. In one corner of the room, a demonstration electromagnetic
manipulator holds a metal sphere suspended in the air. A few people try to break
the EMM's grip, but they are unable to even budge the sphere.

[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at The Torus; Dock Alpha.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, a dark green leather
captain's chair, and a small red insulated cooler here.

chair.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a black plastic tray of spider chow, a compact white refrigerator, a
robotic chef named Nellie, an insulated black cooler, Purr the humanoid service
robot, a pair of washed light khaki canvas sneakers, a pair of white leather
clogs with a row of glittery fireflies across the toes, and Cheri-Pye the
sleeping large light violet felo here.

couch.

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport
Landing Pad.
You see a dusky pink rattan cabinet, a small red ball containing a realistic
Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy pale purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a large oval
dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a white four poster rattan bed with a
heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle
cashmere blanket, a set of lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow,
a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow
on it, a small purple trash bin, a small oval turquoise rattan table with a
glass top, a pocket-sized purple holovid, and a pair of gray canvas sneakers
here.
You can go out.
(You are lying on a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard
and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a set of
lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow, a hand-made purple and
amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it.)

are being carried out in bad faith. If the president's chief negotiator believes

support it? Whether Best was ignorant of or complicit in van Dannikin's

withdrawal attempts.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a black plastic tray of spider chow, a compact white refrigerator, a
robotic chef named Nellie, an insulated black cooler, Purr the humanoid service
robot, and a pair of washed light khaki canvas sneakers here.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident is dozing on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

ftl chetumal
What was once a feature of interstellar geography is now the name of an
alliance, and the heart of Fringe space can be found past this gateway. The tiny
station of Nuevo Laredo stands guard here.
The planet of Chetumal floats before you here, the richest planet among the
Fringe Worlds, although that isn't saying a lot.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Chetumal in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."
Via general sector communication, Chetumal transmits, "Greetings, Deadly Strike!
Welcome to Chetumal Orbit!"

l tiny
a sleeping tiny red soldier felo kitten
This strange, six-legged creature is vaguely wolf-like, though its head appears
almost vulpine. It is small in size and covered in short, striped red fur,
possessing a short, sleek tail that slowly flicks back and forth. The felo's
short, thick legs each end in three-toed paws with thick, curved white claws,
visible only when not retracted. A black, crescent nose sits below a pair of
clear blue eyes with vertical pupils. It appears to be sleeping.
A hefty golden soldier felo seems to be hungry.
A hefty golden soldier felo approaches a crudely hammered scrap metal feeding
trough, glances around, then begins shoveling low-grade dry Felo Chow into its
mouth.
A sleeping hefty red soldier felo begins to snore softly.
An obese red soldier felo seems to be hungry.
An obese red soldier felo approaches a crudely hammered scrap metal feeding
trough, glances around, then begins shoveling low-grade dry Felo Chow into its
mouth.
A hungry red soldier felo marches in from elsewhere.
A sleeping tiny red soldier felo kitten blinks a few times, stands up, and
stretches.
A hungry hefty red soldier felo kitten marches in from elsewhere.

l lily
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident
She appears to be 28 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
mid-back length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick
fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a long-sleeved dark purple tee with a large neon pink spiky
flower appliqued on the front, a pair of skinny faded blue low rise jeans, and a
pair of tan suede clogs. She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer
bracelet around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells
around her wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring
engraved with dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire and small purple
amethyst crystals, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a metallic purple
reinforced plastic phone holster, an elegant white gold ring inset with a
perfect solitaire diamond, a light purple flightbag with a pastel kitten on the
side, and a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled 'Asteria'. Her head,
face, both eyes, neck, both wrists, both hands, and waist are left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.

efficiency and 0% rated maximum velocity)

Distance: 1 unit)

Mk II is operating at 15 damage per turret (100% of rated) and is operating at

read book
An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 27
Chainguns:
CIVIL DEFENSE BASIC CHAINGUN (Drydock)
Requirements: 0 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 2 Grid Usage: 10 Hull Accuracy Added: 12%
Time To Fire: 3s
TENOSQUE DEFENSE ACCELERATED CHAINGUN (New Earth Blazing Trails and New Earth
spaceport)
Requirements: 0 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 4 Grid Usage: 10 Hull Accuracy Added: 10%
Time To Fire: 3s
CHAMPOTON REGIONAL DEFENSE CHAINGUN (Bikura)
Requirements: 100 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 5 Grid Usage: 13 Hull Accuracy Added: 7%
Time To Fire: 3s
RENEGADE ADAPTED CHAINGUN (Endymion and Old Frontier Processor)
Requirements: 200 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 6.5 Grid Usage: 15 Hull Accuracy Added: 8%
Time To Fire: 3s
COALITION REPEATING PROJECTILE TURRET MK I (Drydock)
Requirements: 400 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 9 Grid Usage: 15 Hull Accuracy Added: 5%
Time To Fire: 4s
Chainguns are components one does not often expect to find on an AEU ship. They
don't hurt the combat grid too badly, and some of them have higher hull bonuses
than any other weapons, but they do have their downsides. Chainguns require
ammunition, and time to reload when the turrets run dry. This will mean you
cannot fire for a certain period of time. Also, without bonuses they do not hit
as hard as the other weapons available to us which means you will likely be
stuck in a battle for a longer time than you might want.
[General Communication] Hakeem Oiadip transmits, "I have read them but sometimes
seems I need a translator."
[General Communication] Emily Ford transmits, "Beef fed cornstalks?"
ftl drydock
A lone outpost glitters in an otherwise nondescript cloud of debris.
The League's legendary shipyards hang motionless in the dark here. Once, the
stations would be all but glowing with waste heat as the Intersector
Shipbuilding Company rolled out ship after ship. Now the stations are still and
darkened, and the ISC is no more.
A large frame hangs in space here, sufficiently large to at least contain a
battlecruiser-class starship.
move
AutoStar detects 1 possible destinations.  Assembling destination list.  Please
wait.

voice, "Detecting vessel 'Kalina.' Welcome to Capital Ship Drydock."

cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
[General Communication] Hakeem Oiadip transmits, "Not really, unless I am
missing more than I think. I don't know who is the journalist and nothing about
the Cunning hammers."
The computer announces, "Beginning cycling."
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from green to yellow. Through
your suit, you hear the hiss of air quickly leaving the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
red.
out
You exit the ship.

cruiser.
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.

proceed to Providence Station in thirty seconds unless aborted or another
navigation order is entered."

Kalina! Welcome to home space!"

#help buffer
[1;37mCommand[0;37m: #buffer [1;37m{[0;37mhome[1;37m|[0;37mup[1;37m|[0;37mdown[1;37m|[0;37mend[1;37m|[0;37mlock[1;37m|[0;37mclear[1;37m|[0;37minfo[1;37m}[0;37m
         The buffer command allows you to add macros to scroll in case the
         default bindings do not work. The lock options toggles the
         scrolling state of the screen.

         #buffer {find} {number} {text} Jump to the first occasion of text
         or the given occasion by providing the optional number argument.

         #buffer {get} {variable} {line} {range} Store the given line or
         range in the given variable.

         #buffer {write} {filename} Write the buffer to the given file.

[1;37mExample[0;37m: #macro {(press ctrl-v)(press F1)} {#buffer end}
         Associates F1 key to 'scroll buffer to its end' command.
l
[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, a dark green leather
captain's chair, and a small red insulated cooler here.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident is dozing on a dark green leather captain's chair.

#help var
[1;37mCommand[0;37m: #variable [1;37m{[0;37mvariable name[1;37m}[0;37m [1;37m{[0;37mtext to fill variable[1;37m}[0;37m

         Variables differ from the %0-99 arguments in the fact that you can
         specify a full word as a variable, and they stay in memory for the
         full session unless they are changed.  They can be saved in the
         coms file, and can be set to different values if you have two or
         more sessions running at the same time.  Variables are global for
         each session and can be accessed by adding a $ before the variable
         name.

[1;37mExample[0;37m: #alias {target} {#var target %0}
         #alias {x}      {flame $target}

         The name of a variable must exist of only letters and numbers in
         order to be substituted.  If you do not meet these requirements do
         not panic, simply encapsulate the variable in braces:

[1;37mExample[0;37m: #variable {cool website} {http://tintin.sourceforge.net}
         #chat I was on ${cool website} yesterday!.

         Variables can be nested using brackets:

[1;37mExample[0;37m: #var hp[self] 34;#var hp[target] 46

         You can see the first nest of a variable using $variable[+1] and the
         last nest using $variable[-1]. Using $variable[-2] will report the
         second last variable, and so on. To show all indices use $variable[].
         To show all values use $variable[%*] or a less generic regex.

[1;37mComment[0;37m: To see the internal index of a variable use &<variable name>

[1;37mComment[0;37m: A non existent nested variable will report itself as 0.

[1;37mComment[0;37m: You can remove a variable with the #unvariable command.

4,151,835.52 credits.

can reach our performance goals if we try!"

[0m################################ CURSOR OPTIONS ################################[0m
[0m  [AUTO TAB BACKWARD ] [      ] Tab completion from scrollback buffer, backward[0m
[0m  [AUTO TAB FORWARD  ] [      ] Tab completion from scrollback buffer, forward[0m
[0m  [BACKSPACE         ] [\b    ] Delete backward character[0m
[0m  [BACKWARD          ] [\cb   ] Move cursor backward[0m
[0m  [CLEAR LEFT        ] [\cu   ] Delete from cursor to start of input[0m
[0m  [CLEAR LINE        ] [\cc   ] Delete the input line[0m
[0m  [CLEAR RIGHT       ] [\ck   ] Delete from cursor to end of input[0m
[0m  [CONVERT META      ] [\cv   ] Meta convert the next character[0m
[0m  [CTRL DELETE       ] [\cd   ] Delete one character, exit on an empty line[0m
[0m  [DELETE            ] [\e[3~ ] Delete character at cursor[0m
[0m  [DELETE WORD LEFT  ] [\cw   ] Delete backwards till next space[0m
[0m  [DELETE WORD RIGHT ] [      ] Delete forwards till next space[0m
[0m  [ECHO ON           ] [      ] Turn local echoing on[0m
[0m  [ECHO OFF          ] [      ] Turn local echoing off[0m
[0m  [END               ] [\ce   ] Move cursor to end of input[0m
[0m  [ENTER             ] [      ] Process the input line[0m
[0m  [EXIT              ] [      ] Exit current session[0m
[0m  [FORWARD           ] [\cf   ] Move cursor forward[0m
[0m  [HISTORY NEXT      ] [\cn   ] Select next command history entry[0m
[0m  [HISTORY PREV      ] [\cp   ] Select previous command history entry[0m
[0m  [HISTORY SEARCH    ] [\cr   ] Search command history[0m
[0m  [HOME              ] [\ca   ] Move the cursor to start of input[0m
[0m  [INSERT            ] [      ] Turn insert mode on or off[0m
[0m  [MIXED TAB BACKWARD] [\e[Z  ] Tab completion on last word, search backward[0m
[0m  [MIXED TAB FORWARD ] [\t    ] Tab completion on last word, search forward[0m
[0m  [NEXT WORD         ] [\ef   ] Move cursor to the next word[0m
[0m  [PASTE BUFFER      ] [\cy   ] Paste the previously deleted input text[0m
[0m  [PREV WORD         ] [\eb   ] Move cursor to the previous word[0m
[0m  [REDRAW INPUT      ] [\cl   ] Redraw the input line[0m
[0m  [SUSPEND           ] [\cz   ] Suspend program, return with fg[0m
[0m  [TEST              ] [      ] Print debugging information[0m
[0m  [TAB BACKWARD      ] [      ] Tab completion from tab list, backward[0m
[0m  [TAB FORWARD       ] [      ] Tab completion from tab list, forward[0m
