[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, a dark green leather
captain's chair, and a small red insulated cooler here.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident is dozing on a dark green leather captain's chair.
You can go east, southeast, and out.
(You are sitting on a dark green leather captain's chair.)

Subject: Proposal: Edward van Dannikin's escape plan pro...
Author: AEU Pilot Liaison Office
Posted: 07:29 28 August 2317 GST
--
Edward van Dannikin's escape plan proves that the Accord withdrawal negotiations
are being carried out in bad faith. If the president's chief negotiator believes
that the withdrawal will damage the Union, how can any citizen be expected to
support it? Whether Best was ignorant of or complicit in van Dannikin's
treachery, his own fitness to lead and his motives in the withdrawal are called
into serious question. The civilian pilot corps demands an immediate end to the
withdrawal attempts.
--
Agree
Disagree
--
You may vote on this proposal using the voting machine in the conference room.

help voting
--
Star Conquest Help: Mud List Voting
--
We're on several MUD listing sites so that we can always be attracting new
players to the game. You can help us by voting for us at the sites below:
Top Mud Sites:     http://www.topmudsites.com/vote-sc.html
The Mud Connector: http://www.mudconnect.com/mud-bin/vote_rank.cgi?mud=Star+Conq
uest
You can vote every 12 hours. Spamming votes won't help. Top Mud Sites
consistently drives the most new players to the game.
Additionally, we are listed at mudstats.com, which ranks us by our average
number of connected players. If you're really dedicated to helping, consider
just staying connected! Hang out, use DOZE instead of quitting, and so on.
MudStats:          http://mudstats.com/Game/StarConquest.aspx
--
help vot

help ace
--
Star Conquest Help: Aces and Veterans
--
Category: Background
--
In Star Conquest, we have a few levels of pilots beyond your standard pilot.
* Ace pilots are well known by most, if not all pilots in the leagues, and their
actions have been recorded in the annals of history, such that anyone with a
vested interest in the pilot leagues would know of their deeds.
* Veteran pilots transcend the ace classification, in that they tend to be
'larger than life'. A veteran pilot tends to be well known in popular (non-pilot
and otherwise) culture, and more often than not have holovids detailing their
exploits.
Obtaining ace or veteran status is handled primarily ingame, through one's
character's actions, although in some cases it can also be obtained through a
special application in character generation.
The following is a listing of current and former (player character) pilots
holding ace or veteran status.
AEU:
* Ather Jammoa: Ace Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Notable Awards: Phoenix Burst (Medal), Accord of Free Worlds Meritorious
Service Medal, Aria Star (Medal)
    Achievements: Defense of New Earth, Defense of United Stations of the Accord
* Sean Dillon: Retired Former Ace Pilot
    Status: INACTIVE
    Notable Awards: Velourian Star (Medal)
    Other Notes: Acedom removed due to mishandling of delicate diplomatic
situation.
League:
* Alfred Wecksly: Ace Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Notable Awards: Silver Coalition Command Flying Cross
* Nissi Valdaire: Ace Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Notable Awards: League Distinguished Flying Cross, Accord of Free Worlds
Meritorious Service Medal, Aria Star (Medal), Purple Heart (Medal)
Fringe:
* Cesar Ysidro: Ace Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Notable Awards: Burlingame Siegebreaker (Medal)
    Achievements: Defense of Chetumal
    Other Notes: Participant in [CLASSIFIED] Experiment #009703: [CLASSIFIED].
* Darin Frost: Ace Pilot
    Status: INACTIVE
    Achievements: Blockade Runner/Smuggler
    Other Notes: Location unknown.
* Nick Enderton: Ace Pilot
    Status: INACTIVE
    Achievements: Defense of Chetumal
    Other Notes: Location unknown.
* Rowan McKell: Former Veteran Pilot
    Status: INACTIVE
    Achievements: Defense of Chetumal
    Other Notes: Demerited by Nina Thomas for repeatedly speaking ill of the
Confederation of Fringe Worlds.
* Scott Hawkins: Former Ace Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Achievements: Defense of Chetumal
    Other Notes: Former member of the Fringe Navy. Acedom removed, reasons
unknown.
* Tabi Canis: Ace Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Notable Awards: Accord of Free Worlds Meritorious Service Medal
    Achievements: [3 CLASSIFIED ENTRIES], Defense of Chetumal
    Other Notes: [CLASSIFIED]
* Tony Matos: Retired Veteran Pilot
    Status: INACTIVE
    Achievements: Defense of Chetumal
    Other Notes: Lost vision during the Battle of Chetumal, Participant in
Fringe Medical Experiment #001719: [CLASSIFIED]
Mutuality:
* Anfisa of Marzore: Veteran Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Notable Awards: Accord of Free Worlds Meritorious Service Medal, Aria Star
    Achievements: Defense of Sector -1: Renegade Fleet Command Center
    Other Notes: Member of unreg subfactions: Renegade, Marzore Clan, Shade
Clan, Former name: Aradi.
* Dylan Sparks: Ace Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Achievements: Defense of New Beginning
    Other Notes: Member of unreg subfaction: Renegade. Custom made. Location
known.

l photo
a photo of Space Station "Tooth & Claw"; Corridor
[Space Station "Tooth & Claw"; Corridor]
This corridor is very humid and unpleasantly bright. Murals decorate almost
every available surface, from a rich and colorful nebula near the docking area
hatchway to a deep green alien sky with strange flying beasts as you move
further down the corridor. Several hatchways are visible, but all seem to be
sealed.
You see a small metal grating in the photo.
Beneath the Waves of the Ocean, James Kennedy, Ather Jammoa, Nissi
Agnello-Valdaire, Conrad Falkswell, Emma Hughes, and Tabi Canis are in the
photo.
You can go west and up.
put photo in mosaic
You open a mosaic star box for a moment.
You remove a mosaic star box from a leather briefcase for a moment.
You put a photo of Space Station "Tooth & Claw"; Corridor in a mosaic star box.
l photo
a photo of Starship "Fighter Sigma Omega Theta"; Control Room
[Starship "Fighter Sigma Omega Theta"; Control Room]
The core of every starship is the control room. A dais lies at the center of the
room, raised several feet into the air with a smooth curve leading down to the
floorplates and a slight indent at the mostly flattened top.  Dozens of monitors
surround it, split into two separate sections on either side of the dais. There
do not appear to be any keyboards or buttons visible, instead a collection of
pads rest on either side of the dais.  The entire ceiling appears to be a single
light, leaving the room slightly uncomfortably bright.  In a ring around the
outer edge of the floor is a mesh-like grating, from beneath which can be heard
a slow hiss.  The walls are covered in brightly colored murals of an alien
landscape, with several Children of the Sun standing together in similar poses,
as if in the middle of fluid motions. Fierce light shines down from the ceiling,
and the air hangs heavy with moisture. Looking through the windows, you see that
the ship is in space.
You see a Thrall translator device with a bulky human-made attachment welded to
it in the photo.
Beneath the Waves of the Ocean, James Kennedy, Ather Jammoa, Nissi
Agnello-Valdaire, Conrad Falkswell, Emma Hughes, and Tabi Canis are in the
photo.
You can go out.
put photo in mosaic
You open a mosaic star box for a moment.
You remove a mosaic star box from a leather briefcase for a moment.
You put a photo of Starship "Fighter Sigma Omega Theta"; Control Room in a
mosaic star box.

Flight Control: Providence Station here, an AEU corvette has jumped in.
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
Flight Control: Providence Station flight control here, an AEU corvette is
outbound.
Flight Control: Space Station Alpha to New Earth Orbit flight control, we detect
an AEU corvette inbound.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Deadly
Strike! Welcome to home space!"

i
 You are wearing a long-sleeved dark blue tee with a large white lightning bolt
appliqued on the front, a pair of slim navy blue linen trousers, and a pair of
gray canvas sneakers. Underneath this, you are wearing a pair of white cotton
briefs. You are also wearing a keychain, a backpack, a metallic gold touch
einrophone in a black leather phone holster, a solid silver ring engraved with
dolphins, and a gold wrist-mounted chronometer. You are concealing a metallic
silver metachannel FTL communicator, a flight control scanner, a large

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The two-person flare "Deadly Strike" is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.
Your ship 'Deadly Strike' has been automatically moved into a garage.

l
[Starship "Deadly Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, a dark green leather
captain's chair, and a small red insulated cooler here.
Lily Kaise, Phoenix Dissident is dozing on a dark green leather captain's chair.
You can go east, southeast, and out.
[Notification from Space Explorers Amidst The Stars] A load of salvage has been
received at League Salvage Processing Nuclear Temporary Station from the
two-person medium transport "Magnetic Fields". The organization has earned
3,184,199.02 credits.

Chainguns:
CIVIL DEFENSE BASIC CHAINGUN (Drydock)
Requirements: 0 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 2 Grid Usage: 10 Hull Accuracy Added: 12%
Time To Fire: 3s
TENOSQUE DEFENSE ACCELERATED CHAINGUN (New Earth Blazing Trails and New Earth
spaceport)
Requirements: 0 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 4 Grid Usage: 10 Hull Accuracy Added: 10%
Time To Fire: 3s
CHAMPOTON REGIONAL DEFENSE CHAINGUN (Bikura)
Requirements: 100 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 5 Grid Usage: 13 Hull Accuracy Added: 7%
Time To Fire: 3s
RENEGADE ADAPTED CHAINGUN (Endymion and Old Frontier Processor)
Requirements: 200 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 6.5 Grid Usage: 15 Hull Accuracy Added: 8%
Time To Fire: 3s
COALITION REPEATING PROJECTILE TURRET MK I (Drydock)
Requirements: 400 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 9 Grid Usage: 15 Hull Accuracy Added: 5%
Time To Fire: 4s
Chainguns are components one does not often expect to find on an AEU ship. They
don't hurt the combat grid too badly, and some of them have higher hull bonuses
than any other weapons, but they do have their downsides. Chainguns require
ammunition, and time to reload when the turrets run dry. This will mean you
cannot fire for a certain period of time. Also, without bonuses they do not hit
as hard as the other weapons available to us which means you will likely be
stuck in a battle for a longer time than you might want.
turn book to previous
You turn to page Twenty-six.
read book
An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 26
Laser Upgrades:
FRONTIER ANTI-HAZARD LASER (Drydock)
Requirements: 0 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 3 Grid Usage: 30 Hull Accuracy Added: 12%
Time To Fire: 3s
CENTAURIAN CIVIL DEFENSE LASER (Bikura)
Requirements: 0 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 5 Grid Usage: 20 Hull Accuracy Added: 10%
Time To Fire: 3s
EAOS WARTIME AUGMENTED DEFENSE LASER (Bikura)
Requirements: 100 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 6 Grid Usage: 18 Hull Accuracy Added: 7%
Time To Fire: 3s
COALITION STANDARD LASER MK IV (Drydock)
Requirements: 200 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 7.35 Grid Usage: 20 Hull Accuracy Added: 8%
Time To Fire: 3s
AEU NAVAL HEAVY LASER (Bikura)
Requirements: 240 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 18 Grid Usage: 32 Hull Accuracy Added: 0%
Time To Fire: 5s
VORTEX INDUSTRIES INTENSITY LASER V2 (New Earth allied and Aenea)
Requirements: 350 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 10 Grid Usage: 25 Hull Accuracy Added: 5%
Time To Fire: 4s
FIENSTEIN EXPERIMENTAL HEAVY LASER (Aenea and New Earth Allied Technologies)
Requirements: 500 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 23 Grid Usage: 42 Hull Accuracy Added: 0%
Time To Fire: 5s
CAPELLA NAVAL OFFENSIVE LASER (Endymion)
Requirements: 700 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 13 Grid Usage: 30 Hull Accuracy Added: 5%
Time To Fire: 4s
EAOS CRYSTALLINE OPTICS LASER MK II (Endymion)
Requirements: 950 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 15 Grid Usage: 35 Hull Accuracy Added: 5%
Time To Fire: 4s
COALITION SUPER-HEAVY LASER MK II (Capella)
Requirements: 980 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 30 Grid Usage: 50 Hull Accuracy Added: 0%
Time To Fire: 5s
Lasers are most often an AEU pilot's favorite weapon. This is mostly due to the
fact that most AEU ships get nice bonuses for our laser turrets, which makes
using them more worthwhile than using something like chainguns. In some
instances, the lasers also get a really good hull bonus which make them more
useful than heavy launchers if you have a strong enough laser upgrade. The
downside to using lasers however, is that they really drain the combat grid. So
you'll want to find a laser turret that has a good balance between damage, hull
bonus and combat energy grid. There is also a time issue, too. Some of the
heavier lasers pack a nice punch, but have a five second firing time. This could
theoretically hamper your ability to destroy ships in a timely manner. Note: the
potential damage points information in the above stats do not reflect the
additional bonus damage points available in some AEU ships.

You close a copy of "An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades".
